intro: Cyphostemma greenwayi, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant, white flowers that are followed by distinctive, elongated fruits. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Cyphostemma greenwayi is also known for its ability to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions.
